titleStmt.title: France, Paris, Bibliothèque nationale de France, Latin 5691

persName.affiliation: Kenneth Spencer Research Library, University of Kansas

availability.licence: Distributed under a Cretive Commons Attribution-NonCommercial 4.0 International (CC BY-NC 4.0).

msItem.author: Dictys Cretensis
Dictys of Crete
msItem.title: Ephemeridos belli Troiani
msItem.bibl: Dictys Cretensis. Ephemeridos belli Troiani libri. A Lucio Septimio ex Graeco in Latinum sermonem translati. Accedunt papyri Dictys Graeci in Aegypto inventae. Ed. Werner Eisenhut. 2nd edn. Bibliotheca scriptorum Graecorum et Romanorum Teubneriana (Stuttgart: B. G. Teubner, 1973; 1994).
msItem.note: This manuscript is not used in the edition.
msItem.decoNote: There is a six-line decorated boxed initial S on fol. at the beginning of the translator's prologue.

msItem.title: Translator’s Prologue
msItem.rubric: Incipit historia belli troiani a gnosio cretense descripta qui fuit comes idomenei. prologus
msItem.incipit:
SEptiminus quinto aradio salutem dicit. Efemeriden belli troiani dictis creten
sis qui in ea militia cum idomeneo meruit conscripsunt litteris punicis
msItem.explicit: Tu rufine mi ut par est faue ceptis atque in legendo dictin

msItem.title: Book I
msItem.incipit:
CUncti reges qui minois iove geniti pronepotes grecie imperitabant ad dividendas inter
se atrei opes cretam convenere
msItem.explicit: Hoc modo ex aulide navigatum est
msItem.finalRubric: Historie belli troiani liber primus explicit

msItem.title: Book II
msItem.incipit:
POSTQuam admmissorum regionem universas classes uenti appulere propere omnes signo
dato naues littori admouerunt
msItem.explicit:
Cete
rum per id tempus hiemis sepe Greci atque troiani singuli pluresue ut fors evenerat inter se sine ullo metu in luco thimbrei apollinis miscebantur
msItem.finalRubric: Historie belli troiani liber secundus explicit

msItem.title: Book III
msItem.incipit: INterim per totam hyemem dilato conditionibus in tempus bello Greci cuncta que in tali otio militia exposcebat intenti animo summis studiis festinabant
msItem.explicit:
Ita priamus recepto hectoris cadauere ascensoque
uehiculo cum his qui secum comittati erant ad troiam redit
msItem.finalRubric: Historie belli troiani liber tercius explicit

msItem.title: Book IV
msItem.incipit:
SEd postquam troianis palam est regem perfecto negocio inuiolatum atque integro
comitatu regredi admirati laudantes que grecie pietatem ad celum ferunt
msItem.explicit:
Ita composito negotio antenor tradditoque sibi thalthibio quo res finem acciperet
ad troiam uenit
msItem.finalRubric: Historie belli troiani liber quartus explicit

msItem.title: Book V
msItem.incipit:
ANtenore talthibioque ciuitatem ingressis cuncti populares sociique cognita re propere
concurunt cupientes dignoscere que apud grecos actitata essent
msItem.finalRubric: Historie belli troiani liber quintus explicit

msItem.title: Book VI
msItem.incipit:
POstquam impositis que singuli bello quesierant escendere ipsi solitis anchoralibus
punere ad egeum mare
msItem.explicit:
Ita ulixes ubi uim ingruentium somniorum predictumque ab interpretibus vite
exitum animo recordatus est uulneratus ab eo quem minime crediderat triduo post mortem obiit
senior iam prouectaeque etatis neque tamen inualidus UIRIUM
msItem.finalRubric: Historie belli troiani liber sextus explicit

msItem.author: Publius Flavius Vegetius Renatus
msItem.title: De re militari
msItem.bibl: Flavi Vegeti Renati Epitoma rei militaris. Ed. Karl Lang. 2nd edn. Bibliotheca scriptorum Graecorum et Romanorum Teubneriana (Leipzig: B. G. Teubner, 1885; 1967).
msItem.note: This manuscript is not used in the edition.
msItem.decoNote: There is an eight-line decorated boxed initial P on fol. 21r at the beginning of the text.
msItem.incipit:
PRIMUS liber electionem edocet iuniorum ex quibus locis uel quales mili
tes probandi sint aut quibus armorum generibus exercitus imbuendi
msItem.explicit: Flauius Eutropius emendauit sine exemplario constantinopoli consul valentinano augustus vii et abieni

supportDesc.foliation: Foliated 1-42 in dark brown ink on the top right corner of each recto.
supportDesc.condition: The manuscript shows signs of damage from water on the lower part of its leaves but generally is in good condition.

layout.catchwords: There are decorated horizontal catchwords at center in lower margins on fols , and .
layout.signatures: The three catchwords found in the middle of the lower margins of the leaves serve as quire signatures.

handDesc.handNote: The manuscript is written in gothic textura by a single hand, Pantaleon da Crema.

decoDesc.decoNote: There are paragraph marks in red signalling the beginning of sentences throughout the manuscript.

additions.p: There are marginal annotations and corrections on fols , , , , by different hands.

binding.p: Modern. Quarter leather and paperboard binding with marbled pastedowns.

origin.origDate: The end of the fourteenth century.

history.provenance: There is an owership mark on fol. 42v that reads Iste liber est mei Angelli de Sanguineis de Roma, indicating that the manuscript was owned by Angelo de Sanguineis de Roma.
France, Paris, Bibliothèque nationale de France, Latin 8025 was also written by Pantalemone da Crema and owned by Angelo de Sanguineis de Roma.
The manuscript was later in the possession of the Visconti family, also based in Pavia.
history.acquisition: The manuscript was acquired by the Bibliothèque nationale de France in Paris from the library of King Henry IV.

recordHist.source: First catalogued on July 20, 2019 by N. Kıvılcım Yavuz to be used as part of manuscript description exercises of the "Manuscripts in the Digital Age: XML-Based Catalogues and Editions" Workshop.
recordHist.change: Updated August 1, 2021 by N. Kıvılcım Yavuz. Information may be incomplete or incorrect.
Some attributes updated October 22, 2024 by Katarzyna Anna Kapitan.

surrogates.p: A facsimile of the manuscript is available on Gallica.

listBibl.bibl: Charles R. Shrader. "A Handlist of Extant Manuscripts Containing the De Re Militari of Flavius Vegetius Renatus." Scriptorium 33.2 (1979): 280–305.
